intro: Glomera secunda, commonly known as the silverleaf glomera, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has silver-gray foliage due to a dense covering of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat.
